attributes.action: Help North west England fight the Wild fires in lancashire and Manchester,
attributes.additional_details: The Goverment need to set up a emergency meeting to help support the north west. Fire fighters declared a major incident.
attributes.background: 30 degree heat, stuck up on the moors. Fire fighters working 16 hour days. Support from local people to feed and water the fire fighters. This fire is spreading fast and the fire service have limited resources. We demand support for the north west to eliminate these fires.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the fires in North West England, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

The Government answered an Urgent Question about the  fire at Saddleworth and Tameside Moor on 2 July. You can find out more here:

https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2018/july/urgent-question-on-ongoing-fire-at-saddleworth-2-july-2018/
